definition: tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
the truth about sth/the actual facts

sentences.chinese: 我爲這件事感到真抱歉，魚啊。

sentences.english: I am tired of hunting the same old coon.
sentences.chinese: 反覆幹同樣的事，我真幹膩了。

sentences.english: She had the good fortune to BE in excellent health all her life.
sentences.chinese: 她一輩子身體都很好，真有福氣。

sentences.english: The film about the death of a young child was one that really tugged at my heartstrings.
sentences.chinese: 這部描寫一個小孩之死的電影真讓我揪心。

sentences.english: Your raw wool scarf is so beautiful; where did you buy it?
sentences.chinese: 你這條原毛圍巾真漂亮，是從哪兒買的？
邁克，我真佩服你的勇氣。

sentences.english: Hate does not feel disgusting of war.
sentences.chinese: 討厭卻不能撕破臉的感覺真噁心。

sentences.english: Thanks so much. I owe you one.
sentences.chinese: 真謝謝你，我欠你一份情。

sentences.english: A true friend stabs you in the front.
sentences.chinese: 真朋儕纔會當面中傷定位。

sentences.english: Nice to meet you, Han Mei.
This New Year's day, I had a really happy.
sentences.chinese: 這個元旦節，我過得真快樂。

sentences.english: I really admire your courage in biting your toe nail in public.
sentences.chinese: 我真信服你敢於在平易近衆場所咬腳趾甲的勇氣。

sentences.english: Just worked to reporter station, I am to have some of feeling of two one bring shame on really.
sentences.chinese: 剛到記者站工作，我是真有些兩眼一抹黑的感覺。

sentences.english: To learn about the Wolong Panda Reserve was really interesting.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解到臥龍熊貓保護區的情況真有意思。

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo summarize the experience of diagnosis and treatment of true hermaphroditism.
sentences.chinese: 目的總結對真兩性畸形的診斷和治療經驗。

sentences.english: A shirt that says "Hawaii is beautiful".
sentences.chinese: 一種上面印着“夏威夷真美麗”的襯衫。

definition: indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
really/as expected/sure enough/if indeed.../if it's really...
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
